SubLeg.Descr:
Your trip starts in the southeast of Andalusia in the city of Almeria, the capital of the province of the same name. Throughout history, Almeria's harbor has been an important hub for various goods from tin in the Bronze Age over rasins and silk in the time of Moorish reign to iron ore in the 19th century. Today, its economy builds mainly around vegetable production, with the whole region plastered with hunders of greenhouses, supplying much of Europe.
After departure, head west over a first bunch of greenhouses towards the harbor and the historic center "La Medina" of Almeria, your first waypoint. Towering on a hill west of the Medina, you might be able to spot the Alcazaba, a huge Moorish castle. It is in fact the second largest among the Muslim fortresses of Andalusia, only topped by the famous Alhambra of Granada.

Head southwest towards the "Poniente Almeriense" also known as the "Mar de plastico" (sea of plastic). If you look down, you will understand, where this name originates. Admidst this "sea" you will find an (actual) lake - your next waypoint.

Close to the lake, you will find the city of El Ejido. As you might guess, the city is the centre of production for fruit and vegetables in this region. Special geological conditions made it possible that the region around El Ejido became Europ's biggest "winter garden". The vegtable economy brought wealth to the region but also social and ecological problems, like wage dumping, huge land and water consumption and massive use of pesticides.

Leaving El Ejido in northeastern direction, fly along the southeastern slope of the Sierra de Gador tracking the road A-358 until you reach the city of Berja. A rather large intersection of the westbbound A-358 and the northbound A-347 marks your next waypoint.

Don't follow either of these roads but head northeast through a valley where you find the last outskirts of geenhouse economy. The valley eventually leads to your next waypoint, a small reservoir, the "Embalse de Beninar".

Head north, tracking the river that runs into the reservoir upstream. Follow the left fork of the river until you reach your next waypoint, the city of Ugijar situated at the foot of the Sierra Nevada - Andalusia's highest mountains. To the far left, you might be able to spot the highest point continental spain - Pico de Mulhacen (3482m).

Heading east, track the road A-348 along the valley between the Sierra Nevada in the north and the Sierra de Gador in the south. Near the town of Fondon, the road crosses the river Rio Andarax that is coming down from the mountains and bending eastward. This is your next waypoint.
Follow either the A-348 through the mountains or stay in the valley tracking Rio Andarax. At your next waypoint, the small town of Canjayar, road and river meet again and run east alongside.

Follow the road and the river heading southeast. The road later bends farther south, but you should stay with the river until you cross the dry river bed of the Rambla de Gergal. Shortly after, you can spot the river making a distinctive U-shaped bend with a railroad and a road crossing the western leg of the "U".

Follow the railroad to the north. In the east, you can see Europe's only desert, the Desierto de Tabernas. With its landscape form similar to the one of Arizona or New Mexico, the region has been a popular movie setting in the 1960s for example for the "Spaghetti"-Western "Once Upon a Time in the West" and "The Good, the Bad and the Ugly" by Sergio Leone. When the railroad crosses the motorway A-92, you will be able to spot an airport surrounded by some greenhouses. This is your destination for this leg, the Aerodromo de Gergal (2575 AMSL).

Follow tha A-92 motorway west until you reach your first waypoint, the solar power station "Andasol". The facility consists of three plants built next to each other. They use parabolic troughs to concentrate sunlight in order to generate heat for driving steam turbines. Additionally, they also use tanks of molten salt as thermal energy storage to be able to generate electricity even when the sun is not shining. In 2018, Andasol 3 produced 134.1 GWh of electric energy.
Turn northwest to get to the city of Guadix. The city is famous for its caves carved in tuff rocks that are used as houses probably since prehistoric times up to today.

The airport is situated north of the city (3451 AMSL). Shortly before you reach the airport, you will pass the race track "Circuit Guadix", a popular test track for racing teams from all over the world.

Navigation will be a bit more challenging in this leg. After departure, head northeast towards Cerro Jabalcon, an isolated mountain with a height of 1494 m. Close to the mountain, there is a big reservoir, the Embalse del Negratin. The reservoir is the third-largest in the region of Andalusia. At the foot of Jabalcon, the reservoir forks - this is your first waypoint.

Follow the left fork and track the river that runs into the reservoir upstream until you reach another smaller reservoir, Embalse de la Bolera. The large mountainous area that you entered is known as the Sierras de Cazorla, Segura y Las Villas Natural Park.

Don't follow the river further upstream but turn right and fly into the valley that stretches in northeastern direction until you reach the end of the valley. Remember to gain some altitude as you will need it in the next subleg.
Turn left and cross the mountain ridge. At the other side of the ridge, you will reach a small road that winds through the forest.
Follow the this road until the forest ends and you reach a pass between two mountain ridges.
Track the road further until you reach a fork with one branch going straight north while the main road heads east.
Follow the main road first east and then again northeast through another valley. After you clear the valley, you will reach your next waypoint, the small village of Don Domingo.

Follow the small road that leaves the village in northwestern direction uphill. After the road has reached the top of the mountain ridge, it makes a distincitve U-shaped turn with forest ourside of the "U" and fields inside.

A small track branches off the road at the bottom of the "U". Follow this track, it will lead you to your destination for this leg - the small airstip Santiago-Pontones. If you get lost, you can try using the VORDME YES (115.20). The airstrip is situated at a distance of 21nm from the VOR on the 222 degree radial.

Leg.Descr: Santiago-Pontones to Aerodromo de Las Canadillas

SubLeg.Descr: After departure, head west to another big reservoir, Embalse del Tranco de Beas. Through this reservoir runs the longest river of Andalusia, Rio Guadalquivir.

Follow the reservoir north and fly along the valley that streches northeast of the reservoir until you reach the small town of Segura de la Sierra situated on a hilltop on the right side of the valley.
Turn east into the mountains. Your next waypoint is a high mountain with a streched plateau - Calar del Espino.
Fly further east until you cross Rio Segura. This is where you will shortly leave Andalusia and enter the region Castilla-La Mancha.
Fly alongside the river northeast to your next waypoint - another reservoir as you might have guessed.
The reservoir is fed by two rivers, Rio Segura that you just followed and Rio Tus. Follow this other arm of the reservoir back to the point where it narrows down again to a normal river.

Turn right and follow the valley that runs north. Fly a bit further north until you reach the rather deep river valley of Rio Mundo. To your right on the south side above the valley lies your destination, Aerodromo de Las Canadillas. Again a tip if you get lost: The airstrip is situated at a distance of 9.4nm on the 26 degree radial of VOR YES (115.20).

Leg.Descr: Aerodromo de Las Canadillas (LEML) to Aerodromo Puente de Genave (LEPE)

SubLeg.Descr: After departue, follow the river Rio Mundo in the valley to the west until you clear the valley and the river makes a turn to the left.

You might have noticed, that alongside the river in the valley you just passed ran a road. This road now parts from the river in western direction. Follow this road to your next waypoint, the village of Riopar Viejo, situated quite prominently on a hill on the right side of the road.
Turn southwest and pass between or above the mountains to reach your next waypoint, the reservoir "Embalse de Siles".
Follow the river Rio Guadalimar, that leaves the reservoir on its southwestern end. Eventually, the river makes a turn to the right. This is your next waypoint.
Continue tracking the river. It wil lead you directly to your destination for this leg, Aerodromo Puente de Genave.

Leg.Descr: Aerodromo Puente de Genave (LEPE) to Aerodromo de Linares (LELI)

SubLeg.Descr: Follow again Rio Guadalimar southwest until you reach your first waypoint, an airfield with two runways - Beas De Segura.
Turn right, crossing the river, and track the road A-312 to the west. The road runs along a mountain ridge and will lead you to your next waypoint, the city of Santisteban del Puerto.
Follow along the ridge towards a hill that is situated inbetween two reservoirs.

Relatively closeby in the west, you will be able to spot some moutains. Your destination lies directly behind these mountains - Aerodromo de Linares. If you have problems spotting the airfield, look for the city of Linares. The airfield is directly north of the city. You can also use the VOR BLN (116.20), the airfield is in 1.4nm distance from the VOR on the 217 degree radial.

Leg.Descr: Aerodromo de Linares (LELI) to Pista Forestal de Fuencaliente (LEFC)

SubLeg.Descr: Fly towards the mountains in the northwest to your first waypoint, the reservoir "Pantano del Rumblar".
Hop to the next reservoir, "Pantano del Jandula".

Head towards the higher mountains further northwest - Sierra Madrona. The range is named after the madrono, the Strawberry Tree (Arbutus unedo) which is abundant in the area. The first ridge that runs from east to west marks the border between Andalusia and Castilla-La Mancha. You will have to find an opening of the mountains with the river Rio Valmayor running through.
Follow the river into the mountains to its source.

You will notice, that the northern and southern mountain ridges run together in the northwest. Head towards this point until you cross the road N-420. On the west side of the road close to the northern mountain ridge, you will find your destination, the Pista Forestal de Fuencaliente (2580m AMSL). Beware the mountains during approach! If you get lost, try VOR HIJ (114.70), the airfield is on the 89 degree radial at a distance of 33nm.

Leg.Descr: Pista Forestal de Fuencaliente (LEFC) to Aerodromo de Espiel (LEES)

SubLeg.Descr: After departure, you have to gain altitude quickly because you will have to fly over the mountains to the west. When you have cleared the mountains, look for the road A-435, that crosses a river and leads to the small town of Torrecampo, your first waypoint.
Track the A-435 southwest. You will pass another small town before you reach the somewhat bigger town of Pozoblanco.
Pick up the A-435 again. It leaves the ring road around the town in southwestern direction. Eventually, it will intersect the national road N-502, your next waypoint.
Head into the mountainous region southwest. Your destination is closeby, amidst the forest - Aerodromo de Espiel (2362 AMSL). Again a hint: VOR HIJ (114.70), radial 171 degrees, 15nm distance.

Leg.Descr: Aerodromo de Espiel (LEES) to Aerodromo La Balanzona (LECG)

SubLeg.Descr: Another reservoir marks your first waypoint in this leg. Embalse de Puente Nuevo is situated south of your departure airport.

Fly to the southern end of the reservoir and keep track of the river that leaves the lake there, Rio Guadiato. Look for a small lake on the left side of the river sourrounded by a holiday resort. This is your next waypoint.
Your destination is closeby, east of the lake. A golf club is very closeby, so why not improve your handicap after you landed?

Leg.Descr: Aerodromo La Balanzona (LECG) to Flugplatz Palma del Rio (LEPR)

SubLeg.Descr: In this leg, you will visit one of the most famous cities of Andalusia: Cordoba! The city is situated around 5nm south of your departure airport. When you arrive above the city, take your time and do some sightseeing.

Be sure to have a look at La Mezquita, the Great Mosque of Cordoba, is one of the most accomplished monuments of Moorish architecture built by the European Moors. The building is most notable for its arcaded hypostyle hall, with 856 columns made from pieces of Roman builidings. After the Reconquista, the mosque was converted to a church (and is in use as a Catholic place of worship until today). In the 16th century, a cathedral nave was inserted into the builing. Although this severe alteration of the original building was permitted by King Charles V, when he later visited the cathedral, he is said to have famously commented: "You have destroyed something unique to build something commonplace".
Have a look at the Puente Romano, the Roman bridge of Cordoba over Rio Guadalquivir with its fortified gate "Torre de la Calahorra" at its southern side.
Do not miss the Alcazar de los Reyes Cristianos, a medieval palace that once served as one of the primary residences of Isabella of Castile.

When you finished sightseeing, follow Rio Guadalquivir southwest out of the city. Your destination "Palma del Rio" lies on the left side of the river. There is a small lake between airfield and river that might help in spotting your destination.

FormulaParameter.CalculatorFormula: (A:FUEL TOTAL QUANTITY, gallons) (A:UNUSABLE FUEL TOTAL QUANTITY, gallons) -
(A:PLANE ALT ABOVE GROUND, meter) (A:STATIC CG TO GROUND, meter) + 10 >

(A:PLANE ALT ABOVE GROUND, meter) (A:STATIC CG TO GROUND, meter) - 0 >
